ratings.comment: Some students were allegedly talking in lecture and he publicly humiliated them. A few days later he claimed other students were talking, although they were right in front of me and I didn't notice. He said the next people to speak will be removed from lecture and or he will CALL THE POLICE and have them escorted out. Do not recommend his class.

The material is hard and he does not present it in a helpful way. Second two tests are take home, and you can do well if you work in a bright group. Very time consuming though! His annoying political opinions were sprinkled in all over the place. Take the 300 level immuno class unless you're super interested in the subject. Wasn't worth it to me.

I'm really torn with Splitter. On one hand he really cares about the content and his lectures are great, but his exams are near impossible and are crazy time consuming. He also refuses to hold office hours or create a reading syllabus. He clearly cares about the material, but not so much about the students taking the class.

The material is hard. He is not the greatest teacher in the world, but you can tell he cares. First test is really hard, avg was a 59%. Second two tests are take home, and you can do well. He gave a little bit more political opinions on healthcare and so on that I didn't really care to hear or think was appropriate, but such is Madison.

Great class. Lectures go very fast and cover a lot of material, but it's all very important. I suggest emailing him whenever you have questions and actually read the book. It will definitely help. He also incorporates life lessons into his lectures, which is interesting, and ended the semester with two great videoes on cancer treatment.

Splitter is a very nice, intelligent guy who means well, but teaching is simply not one of his strengths. The class is very disorganized to start out with, especially if you don't have an immunology background. The first test is very hard, but the 2nd and 3rd are doable if you have a good group to work with. Amazing curve at the end!

Large amount of material covered with badly phrased test questions.  Class is full of grad/med students with a few doctors and nurses. His teaching style tries to be engaging, but doesn't make it most of the time.

He's a good guy, wants to be engaging and interesting, but he's too disorganized to be effective. I attended class every day and I still found his slides unhelpful. I think he's been teaching the class for so long he doesn't put much effort into it. Lots of material, but doable if you're willing to study hard and deconstruct the lecture slides.

He's a good guy, wants to be engaging and interesting, but he's too disorganized to be effective. I attended class every day and I still found his slides unhelpful. I think he's been teaching the class for so long he doesn't put much effort into it. Lots of material, but doable if you're willing to study hard and deconstruct the lecture slides.

he is a very entertaining lecturer, the material he presents in class are very easy to understand, test questions could be better written, the highest score on any exam is approx. an 85% (the class is primarily premed, mmi majors, or grad students), he does a nice curve for each exam

Tons of material covered, and horrible (badly phrased) test questions.  Class is loaded with med students and several doctors.  His teaching style tries to be engaging, but doesn't make it most of the time.

I loved MMI 341...I dislike 528.  He's not very clear.  Only take if you want to have babies with immunology or if you absolutely have to.  There are grad. students and we had a transplant surgeon in our class.  Not a horrendous class, but I didn't enjoy it like I thought I would
